results.title: Closing the Gap
results.creator_credit: Chelsea Studios for the Education Department of Victoria, Les Mack and Glenn Mack
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program of Victoria. Raises issues of concern for those attempting to bridge the gap between schools and the local community. Depicts the first tentative steps of a small inner-city secondary school.
Filmed at the historic, heritage registered building on City Road, Southbank, formerly the J.H. Boyd Girls’ High School, now (2017) known as the ‘Boyd Community Hub’.

results.title: Closing behaviour (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: University of Southern California, Patricia Heffernan-Cabrera and Phil Content
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Interaction in the Multicultural Classroom”.
An introduction to various sorts of closing behaviour often used by the classroom teacher - shifting attention from one child to another, not listening fully to the child’s response - the film points out that too much closing behaviour prevents children developing.

results.title: Closet space
results.creator_credit: Cindigo Vision, Karen Taylor and Colleen Farrelly
results.brief_description: Parents with gay children share their experiences and feelings, fears and joys on discovering that their child is gay. A parents supporting parents Flag (South Australia), which aims to bring families together and break down the barriers of homophobia. An honest and open discussion piece which challenges and debates notions of heterosexism as parents and children share their personal stories.

results.title: Closely observed trains = Ostre sledovane vlaky [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Barrandov Studios, Zdenek Oves and Jiri Menzel
results.brief_description: During the German occupation, a young man, Milos, (Vaclav Neckar) works as a trainee railway guard in a country station. He has only one thing on his mind; to lose his virginity, possibly with the wife of the station master (Libuse Havelkova). His attempts take him through the trauma of premature ejaculation, an attemped suicide and finally success with a member of the Underground movement, before tragedy strikes. “Closely observed trains” is adapted from a novel by Bohumil Hrabal. This film is one of the finest achievements of the Czech “New Wave” and was the second Czech film to win an Oscar for best foreign film in 1967. The film was banned after the Soviet invasion of 1969 as “pornographic”. Also known as “Closely watched trains”. In Czech with English subtitles.

results.title: Closed Mondays
results.brief_description: In a combination of graphics and three-dimensional clay figures, a little man discovers the world of art. He sees an open door and wanders through into an art exhibition. Paintings come alive and move around him as he watches. As he turns to go, he himself is put on a pedestal and bronzed. A 1975 Academy Award winner. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Closed chest and cardiac massage
results.creator_credit: Stewart Hardy Films and Guy Fergusson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Emergency Resuscitation”.
The techniques of closed chest cardiac massage is demonstrated by instructor, and by means of animated diagrams. The need for correct technique is stressed, when the method is used, accompanied by exhaled air resuscitation in cases of cardiac arrest and respiratory failure. The hazards of careless of misdirected application are explained.

results.title: Close your eyes and hold your stomach
results.brief_description: In a survey of some of the ways Australian children are discovering their own kind of theatre, this film focuses on a touring children’s theatre company, the Pageant Theatre in Education, which tours Australian schools. School children are invited by the actors to participate in the production of each play and their responses influence the shape of the play. Children of different age groups are observed creating fantasy worlds on the one hand and recreating political and social issues on the other. Made with the assistance of the Australian Film & Television School. Narrated by Robert Bruning.

results.title: Close to the basket moves
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basketball Skills”.
One in a series of films on basketball skills, giving instruction and demonstration of basketball techniques, including slow-motion action and training routines

results.title: Close harmony
results.brief_description: An inspiring documentation of the work of music teacher Arlene Symons in bringing together a chorus of children from the 1979-1980 class of the Friends School in Brooklyn, New York and the senior chorus from the Council Centre for Senior Citizens, Brooklyn. Three months of separate rehearsals took place, and a pen pal program set up between the two groups. A week before the concert, the groups came together.
